text.content:
CC
Renew meds, follow up depression. 
 
Subjective
pt reports no significant interval changes.
 
Diabetes mellitus type 2
No hypoglycemia episodes.  Working on diet and exercise, but doesnt feel that it 
does any good.  She walks about 20 minutes each weekday (during her lunch break 
at work).  Says she doesnt eat much sweets but doesnt pay much attention to the 
details of her diet since diets have never worked for her in the past. Not 
limiting carbohydrates or fruits.
 
Hypertension
No light-headedness.  BP has been good.
 
Postoperative hypothyroidism
No constipation, diarrhea, fatigue, insomnia or palpitations.
 
Depression
Doing well with no significant depression episodes.  No SI and no HI.
 
 
Allergies
Metformin (severe nausea)
Fluoxetine (severe anxiety)
Citalopram (severe anxiety)
 
 
PMH
Hypertension
Depression
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Hyperlipidemia
Osteopenia
History of malignant neoplasm of thyroid
Postoperative hypothyroidism
 
PSurgHx
Thyroidectomy (complete, bilateral): 2002
 
 
FamHx
Diabetes mellitus type 2 and osteoporosis in the patients mother.
 
 
SocHx
Divorced mother of 5 (her two youngest children live with her; they are 15 and 
17-years-old).
The patient quit smoking about 7 years ago.  She drinks alcohol rarely.  She 
denies use of illicit drugs.
The patient works as an administrative assistant at a law firm in town.
 
 
MEDICATIONS:
Active Inpatient and Outpatient Medications (including Supplies):
 
     Outpatient Medications                                 Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN 81MG EC TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE 1.25GM (CA 500MG) TAB TAKE 500 MG    ACTIVE
       BY MOUTH THREE TIMES A DAY
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE 25MG TAB TAKE 12.5 MG  BY MOUTH EVERY   ACTIVE
       DAY
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL 1000 UNIT CAP TAKE 1000 UNITS BY MOUTH  ACTIVE
       EVERY DAY
5)   GLYBURIDE 2.5MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) 0.125MG TAB TAKE ONE      ACTIVE
       TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY DAY
7)   LISINOPRIL 20MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY     ACTIVE
       DAY
8)   SIMVASTATIN 80MG TAB TAKE ONE TABLET BY MOUTH EVERY    ACTIVE
       EVENING
9)   VENLAFAXINE HCL 75MG SA CAP TAKE THREE CAPSULES BY     ACTIVE
       MOUTH DAILY

ALLERGIES/ADRS:
METFORMIN, CITALOPRAM, FLUOXETINE


OBJECTIVE:
VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  138/72 (07/03/2013 15:13)
          Pulse:  78 (07/03/2013 15:13)
    Temperature:  98.8 F [37.1 C] (07/03/2013 15:13)
   Respirations:  16 (07/03/2013 15:13)
         Weight:  231 lb [105.0 kg] (07/03/2013 15:13)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  40
           Pain:  1 (07/03/2013 15:13)


 
EXAM:
GEN: NAD, obese
FEET: normal monofilament test bilaterally; no abnormal lesions noted; normal DP 
pulses bilaterally
PSYCH: normal mood and behavior
 
Assessment and Plan
 
Diabetes mellitus type 2
Assessment
Control of Diabetes mellitus type 2 is stable.
Last HbA1c was 6.8 (within goal range). 
Due for eye exam next year.
Plan
Check Microalbumin/Creat.
Check HbA1c
Continue Aspirin 81 mg daily to prevent  stroke
Continue Glyburide 2.5 mg daily to decrease HbA1c
Encouraged patient to limit portion sizes and avoid fatty foods, simple 
sugars and too many carbs.  Congratulated patient on exercise she is doing and 
recommended she increase duration of walking to 30 minutes 5 days per week.
 
Hypertension
Assessment
Control of Hypertension is stable.
Well controlled on Lisinopril 20 mg and Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg.  No light-
headedness.  Creatinine and potassium were within normal limits when last 
checked about 10 months ago.
Plan
Continue Chlorthalidone 12.5 mg daily to decrease SBP and DBP
Continue Lisinopril 20 mg daily to decrease DBP and SBP
Check Chem14
 
Postoperative hypothyroidism
Assessment
Control of Postoperative hypothyroidism is stable.
Has been well controlled; due for TSH today.
Plan
Continue Levothyroxine 125 mcg daily

 
Depression
Assessment
Control of Depression is improved. 
 
Plan
Continue Venlafaxine SA 225mg daily and MH clinic.
 
Hyperlipidemia
Assessment
Control of Hyperlipidemia is stable.
Plan
Check Lipid panel
Continue Simvastatin 80 mg daily to decrease LDL, and increase HDL
 
Misc.
Plan
Obesity: pt agrees to set a goal to lose 50 pounds over the next year. (she lost 
about 5 over the past year) I encouraged her to focus on decreased portion sizes 
and to avoid high calorie foods including regular soda and high fat snacks.  I 
also encouraged her to walk at least 30 to 60 minutes 5 days per week.
 
RTC 12 months


  Depression Screening:
    PHQ-2
      A PHQ-2 screen was performed. The score was 0 which is a negative
          screen for depression.

          1. Little interest or pleasure in doing things
          Not at all

          2. Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
          Not at all
  Hypertension:
    The patient was educated on the importance of diet and of regular
    exercise and/or physical activity in the control of blood pressure.
  Diabetes - Urinalysis:
    Urinalysis ordered.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN
